column4: Hello.. I am trying to mount a USB CDRW/DVD drive with no success. The /scd0 mount point doesn't seem to work (it is binded to /cdrom as it was the default drive) and it is odd, as when I insert a music CD, it detects it, but cannot play the music itself. How can I get it to work?
How idea about the CDRW/DVD drive?

Hello.. I am trying to mount a USB CDRW/DVD drive with no success. The /scd0 mount point doesn't seem to work (it is binded to /cdrom as it was the default drive) and it is odd, as when I insert a music CD, it detects it, but cannot play the music itself. How can I get it to work?
So I guess thats a no?
No one here has ever mounted a USB CD-ROM through Linux?
well i mount a usb hard drive through linux....should be similar to cd
well i do a dmesg to find out what the usb assignment is when i plug the hard drive in..
yes do you see the info in dmesg after the kernel picks up the cd
sounds like you misspelled something in your mount command
No. I typed it correctly.
ok what does dmesg say is it still using /dev/sr)
ok and you have a cd in it and you typed mount -t iso9660 /dev/sr0 /media/usbcdrom
are all characters lower case
In my command?
ok forget the mount...there is a more basic problem
try unplugging the usb and plugging in again and read dmesg again
you need to get a clear message from dmesg before bothering with mount
The second message is the error I get when I try to point it.
ok what does the dmesg section say
is it giving you i/o errors
well the kernel picked it up ok...so try another known good cd
